intro: Anotites bakeri, commonly known as the Baker's anotites, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
